intro: Psychotria potanthera subsp. sapobana, commonly known as the sapobana psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. This plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale green, with prominent yellow stamens. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and understorey environments. Its ornamental value and unique botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
